description: Creates a new EMAIL or VOICE contact.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instance ID in the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If not provided, the Amazon Web Services SDK populates this field. For more information about idempotency, see Making retries safe with idempotent APIs. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: A custom key-value pair using an attribute map. The attributes are standard Amazon Connect attributes, and can be accessed in flows just like any other contact attributes. There can be up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all key-value pairs per contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, dash, and underscore characters. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: References
parameters.description: A formatted URL that is shown to an agent in the Contact Control Panel (CCP). Tasks can have the following reference types at the time of creation: URL | NUMBER | STRING | DATE | EMAIL | ATTACHMENT. (string) --- (dict) --- Well-formed data on a contact, used by agents to complete a contact request. You can have up to 4,096 UTF-8 bytes across all references for a contact. Value (string) --- A valid value for the reference. For example, for a URL reference, a formatted URL that is displayed to an agent in the Contact Control Panel (CCP). The type of the reference. DATE must be of type Epoch timestamp. Status (string) --- Status of the attachment reference type. Arn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the reference StatusReason (string) --- Relevant details why the reference was not successfully created.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: A valid value for the reference. For example, for a URL reference, a formatted URL that is displayed to an agent in the Contact Control Panel (CCP).

nested_params.name: Type
nested_params.description: The type of the reference. DATE must be of type Epoch timestamp.

nested_params.name: Status
nested_params.description: Status of the attachment reference type.

nested_params.name: Arn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the reference.

nested_params.name: StatusReason
nested_params.description: Relevant details why the reference was not successfully created.

parameters.name: InitiationMethod
parameters.description: Indicates how the contact was initiated.

parameters.name: UserInfo
parameters.description: User details for the contact UserId (string) --- The user identifier for the contact.

nested_params.name: UserId
nested_params.description: The user identifier for the contact.

parameters.name: SegmentAttributes
parameters.description: A set of system defined key-value pairs stored on individual contact segments (unique contact ID) using an attribute map. The attributes are standard Amazon Connect attributes. They can be accessed in flows. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, -, and _. This field can be used to set Segment Contact Expiry as a duration in minutes. (string) --- (dict) --- A value for a segment attribute. This is structured as a map where the key is valueString and the value is a string. ValueString (string) --- The value of a segment attribute. ValueMap (dict) --- The value of a segment attribute. ValueInteger (integer) --- The value of a segment attribute.

nested_params.name: ValueString
nested_params.description: The value of a segment attribute.

nested_params.name: ValueMap
nested_params.description: The value of a segment attribute.

nested_params.name: ValueInteger
nested_params.description: The value of a segment attribute.

nested_items.name: ContactId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the contact in this instance of Amazon Connect.

nested_items.name: ContactArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created contact.
